issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: This jira is intended to use the perflogger to track compilation times and optimization times (calcite, tez compiler, physical compiler) etc.
fields.summary: PerfLogger for hive compiler and optimizer

comments.body:

ATTACHMENT ID: 12774422 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

[~hsubramaniyan], I have seen that you have added a single performance measurement for Calcite planning.

I was wondering if we would like to have more precise measurements for Calcite, as we have for the other Hive optimizations. For instance, (1) one per optimization call, or (2) one per optimization block (prejoin reordering, join reordering, postjoin reordering), or (3) -another option-. What do you think? [~ashutoshc], what's your opinion?

[~jcamachorodriguez] Thanks for the comments. Can you please look at the latest patch and see if it covers the issue. I will upload it in the review board.

Thanks
Hari
Please make sure that perflogger is not used in any tight loops or such, it's very expensive there.

Patch LGTM +1 For performance, its not inside any loop and is called for each optimization phase, so should not be a drain. 
[~hsubramaniyan] Can you post output of new log lines generated on a non-trivial query so that we have an idea of how it will look like.

[~ashutoshc] Thanks for the review. Here is how the lines would look like :

Query :
{code}
explain select i_item_desc ,i_category ,i_class ,i_current_price ,i_item_id ,sum(ws_ext_sales_price) as itemrevenue ,sum(ws_ext_sales_price)*100/sum(sum(ws_ext_sales_price)) over (partition by i_class) as revenueratio from web_sales ,item ,date_dim where web_sales.ws_item_sk = item.i_item_sk and item.i_category in ('Jewelry', 'Sports', 'Books') and web_sales.ws_sold_date_sk = date_dim.d_date_sk and date_dim.d_date between '2001-01-12' and '2001-02-11' group by i_item_id ,i_item_desc ,i_category ,i_class ,i_current_price order by i_category ,i_class ,i_item_id ,i_item_desc ,revenueratio limit 100
{code}

PerfLog output for optimizer :
{code}

ATTACHMENT ID: 12776145 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

I looked at the above errors, none of them look related to the patch.

Thanks
Hari

[~hsubramaniyan], I did some test runs. Could we separate PreJoin optimizations into individual ones? That would be really useful to really see where the time is spent, and just adds 6 measurements more per query. Thanks

[~jcamachorodriguez] Makes sense. Can you please look at the latest patch.

Thanks
Hari
